meanings.sent1: The bine of the vine wrapped around the fence post.
meanings.sent2: I saw a bine climbing up the tree in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the bine to swing from branch to branch.
meanings.sent4: The bine of ivy seemed to dance in the wind, embracing the tree.
meanings.sent5: The bine's delicate tendrils reached out, searching for support.

meanings.sent1: I watched the vines bine around each other in a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent2: She used the rope to bine the branches together for support.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to bine their jump ropes to make a longer one.
meanings.sent4: The dancers' arms seemed to bine together seamlessly in the performance.
meanings.sent5: The river seemed to bine with the sky at the horizon, creating a stunning view.
